text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This IRM was revised as follows:

IRM Reference Description of Change Title of IRM The title of this IRM was changed from “AIMS/Processing Handbook, Closings to Appeals” to “AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Closings to Appeals.” IRM 4.4.5.1 Updated to clarify IRM instructions for Examination and Technical Services when closing cases to Appeals. IRM 4.4.5.1(2) Added this paragraph to advise of the requirements for sending short statute cases to Appeals. IRM 4.4.5.2. Clarified the importance of accuracy needed when completing Form 5344, Examination Closing Record. IRM 4.4.5.2.1 New section added to clarify group responsibilities for completing Form 5344. IRM 4.4.5.2.2 New section added to clarify Technical Services responsibilities for complet- ing Form 5344. IRM 4.4.5.3 Retitled and provided instructions for Non-Docketed Cases. IRM 4.4.5.4 Retitled and added information for special situations requiring original returns. IRM 4.4.5.5 Retitled and added information for processing skeletal records. IRM 4.4.5.6 Retitled and added information on non-master file transcripts. IRM 4.4.5.7 Retitled and added references from IRM 4.8.2, Technical Services, Case Processing and IRM 4.10.8, Report Writing. IRM 4.4.5.8 Retitled and clarified procedures for closing reference returns to Appeals. IRM 4.4.5.9 Retitled and updated instructions. IRM 4.4.5.10 Retitled and updated instructions. IRM 4.4.5.11 Retitled and updated instructions. IRM 4.4.5.12 New section added to provide instructions on closing IRC 6707A cases. IRM 4.4.5.13 New section added to provide Technical Services responsibility for closing case files to Appeals.
IRM Reference Description of Change IRM 4.4.5.14 New section added to provide updated IRM reference for docketed (peti- tioned) cases.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
IRM 4.4.5, dated 7/11/2005 is superseded.

Form 5344 must be properly completed by the groups before closing the case to Technical Services. Form 5344 is used to enter information into the Automated Information Management System (AIMS) that records the results of the audit before the case file is transferred to Appeals. It is very important that the group maintain the accuracy of the AIMS data with respect to the statute date, source code, status code, etc. Accuracy prevents the case from being rejected and returned to the group before it is closed to Appeals.

AIMS Procedures and Processing (
) Technical Services should review the document titled Form
Entries, of Responsibility. Note: Technical Services will also review the entire completed Form

to ensure accuracy. It is very important that Exam maintains accuracy of the AIMS/ERCS data with respect to the statute date, source code, status etc. Technical Services should not complete any missing exam blocks. Contact should be made with the group to retrieve the missing information ensure accurate AIMS results. (
) Taxpayer requests for Appeals consideration will be acknowledged at the level via Letter
, Transfer to Appeals. The case file will be identified as Cases - “Unagreed to Appeals” by attaching and completing Form
, Special Handling Notice for Examination Case Processing. The group will update ERCS to Status Code

, In-Transit to Technical Services, and update the Technical Service Code (TSC) . Forward the case file to the appropriate Technical Services office for closure to Appeals. The group will document case file as to the date the case was forwarded to Technical Services and date the Letter
was sent to the taxpayer. Technical Services will be re- sponsible for forwarding cases directly to Appeals within
calendar days of receipt via Form
, Document Transmittal. Note: If the case file contains related returns that are agreed/no-changed that should ride along with the protested case to Appeals, the group will Form
, Records Request Charge Re-charge, prior to sending the file to Technical Services. Refer to IRM
, Retiring and Requesting Records, for instructions on
preparation. (
) If the taxpayer submits a written protest after receiving a

-Day letter and requests Appeals consideration, the case file and written protest will be ferred to the appropriate Appeals office. If only one protest is received, the entire case file, including the duplicate original preliminary notice of which response was received, will be transmitted to Appeals by Technical Update ERCS to Status Code
and update the TSC. In order to correctly route Appeals cases, visit “Appeals Case Routing Addresses and at http://appeals.web.irs.gov/APS/caserouting.htm. (

) A transcript of account must be attached to the electronic print of the return. there is any difference between the tax shown on the electronic print and transcript, the difference must be reconciled on a workpaper attached to the transcript. (

It is very important that Exam maintains accuracy of the AIMS/ERCS data with respect to the statute date, source code, status code, etc. Technical Services should not complete any missing exam blocks. Contact should be made with the group to retrieve the missing information to ensure accurate AIMS results. (

was sent to the taxpayer. Technical Services will be re- sponsible for forwarding cases directly to Appeals within

) If the taxpayer submits a written protest after receiving a

-Day letter and requests Appeals consideration, the case file and written protest will be ferred to the appropriate Appeals office. If only one protest is received, the entire case file, including the duplicate original preliminary notice of which no response was received, will be transmitted to Appeals by Technical Services. Update ERCS to Status Code
and update the TSC. In order to correctly route Appeals cases, visit “Appeals Case Routing Addresses and at http://appeals.web.irs.gov/APS/caserouting.htm. (
) A copy of a return, RTVUE, BRTVU or CDE, Compliance Data Environment, print can be used when closing docketed or non-docketed cases to Appeals. See IRM
, Technical Services, Statutory Notices of Deficiency, for structions when tax returns are not available. (

) A transcript of account must be attached to the electronic print of the return. there is any difference between the tax shown on the electronic print and the transcript, the difference must be reconciled on a workpaper attached to the transcript. (

) Appeals will accept copies of returns except in the following situations: unagreed civil fraud, jeopardy assessments, Joint Committee cases, or when delinquency penalty is unagreed. Follow the procedures in IRM
, Statutory Notices of Deficiency, IRM
and IRM
for instruc- tions on securing original returns when necessary.
If the taxpayer submits a written protest after receiving a

-Day letter and requests Appeals consideration, the case file and written protest will be trans- ferred to the appropriate Appeals office. If only one protest is received, the entire case file, including the duplicate original preliminary notice of which no response was received, will be transmitted to Appeals by Technical Services. Update ERCS to Status Code
and update the TSC. In order to correctly route Appeals cases, visit “Appeals Case Routing Addresses and Instructions” at http://appeals.web.irs.gov/APS/caserouting.htm.
Note: If the AIMS database is not able to be closed to Appeals pending receipt of additional information, input a “Q” freeze on the taxpayer module.
When a case is urgently needed by Appeals but the account is not yet a full record on AIMS take the following actions:
a. If the case is in the group, the group should place an AMDISA print in case file reflecting the TC
skeletal record to indicate an AIMS was requested. Complete Form
accordingly, update to Status

on ERCS with the applicable TSC and forward the case file to Technical Services b. Technical Services may send the case to Appeals pending full establish- ment of the return on AIMS. Maintain a copy of all necessary forms for IDRS input and update to Status

as soon as there are full AIMS controls. c. Either the group or Technical Services should monitor the case until the full account is established on AIMS. As soon as there are full AIMS controls, close the return and attach a print of the AMCLSE information an AMDISA reflecting Status
and forward the information to the Appeals office to which the case was closed.

) NMF returns closed to Appeals are processed in the same manner as file cases with the exception of transcripts that may have to be requested the Cincinnati Submission Processing Center. Services Responsibility (
) All cases referred to Appeals will be handled in a priority manner and sent to the Appeals office within ten (
) calendar days, via Form
a. At the end of each month, the tickler file maintained of Form
s will checked for acknowledgements received. Follow-up action will be taken any for which Part
of Form
has been outstanding for
days or longer to determine whether the cases were received by Appeals or why Part

was not returned. b. When the Appeals acknowledgment copy is received from Appeals, destroy the suspense copy and replace it with the Appeals acknowledg- ment copy. The Appeals acknowledgment copy, will be retained for a minimum of one year from date of receipt and will be purged according the business unit’s regularly scheduled purge date.
) See IRM

All cases referred to Appeals will be handled in a priority manner and sent to the Appeals office within ten (10) calendar days, via Form 3210.
a. At the end of each month, the tickler file maintained of Form
s will be checked for acknowledgements received. Follow-up action will be taken any for which Part

has been outstanding for
days or longer to determine whether the cases were received by Appeals or why Part

was not returned. b. When the Appeals acknowledgment copy is received from Appeals, destroy the suspense copy and replace it with the Appeals acknowledg- ment copy. The Appeals acknowledgment copy, will be retained for a minimum of one year from date of receipt and will be purged according to the business unit’s regularly scheduled purge date.
